intro: Lantana venturii, commonly known as the Mexican lantana, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, brightly colored flowers that range from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom throughout the year, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Lantana venturii is also known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its tolerance to drought conditions.
